alert.note: Alert for Kane (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 5:26PM MDT until August 14 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN KANE COUNTY... At 526 PM MDT, Kane County Dispatch and the public reported 3-5" of water flowing in the streets of Kanab. Between 0.75 and 2 inches of rain have fallen from an earlier thunderstorm, but the intense rainfall has ended. Significant ponding of water is already occurring in town, and flash flooding of dry washes in the vicinity remains a potential. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Local Law Enforcement and the Public. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of normally dry washes, urban areas, highways, and streets. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kanab. This includes the following highways... US Route 89 between mile markers 59 and 67. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
